AccountAndSelfService.account_security_self_service: Which security-related actions should users manage themselves (e.g. change password, manage authentication methods, delete account)?
AccountAndSelfService.avatar_and_identity_media_management: Should users be able to upload, update, and remove profile images or other identity-related media in their account?
AccountAndSelfService.login_and_authentication: Do users need to log in and authenticate to access their account-related areas and self-service functions?
AccountAndSelfService.personal_center_scope: What capabilities should the personal center or user portal include beyond basic profile management (e.g. balances, activity records, orders, quick actions)?
AccountAndSelfService.profile_and_account_information_manageme: What profile and account information should users be able to view and manage themselves (e.g. personal details, contact info, preferences, security settings)?
AccountAndSelfService.user_activity_and_history_access: What types of user activity or transaction history should be accessible in self-service (e.g. orders, service records, financial or subscription history, with options to filter, sort, or export)?
AccountAndSelfService.user_registration_and_verification: Do you need a self-registration flow for users, and should it include any additional verification steps or document submission?

AdminAndOperations.admin_interfaces_and_portals: Which dedicated admin or back-office interfaces and portals do you need for different roles or domains (e.g. global admin, operations, merchants, institutions)?
AdminAndOperations.admin_management_scope: Which entities and data domains should be manageable from admin consoles (e.g. users, organizations, resources, inventory, finance, logistics, content)?
AdminAndOperations.admin_user_and_access_management: What capabilities should administrators have for managing users, roles, permissions, and organizational structure?
AdminAndOperations.audit_trails_and_operation_logs: What access should administrators have to audit trails and operation logs, and how should they be searchable or filterable?
AdminAndOperations.monitoring_dashboards_and_system_overvie: Do you need admin dashboards or overview pages for monitoring key metrics, system status, and operational performance?
AdminAndOperations.operational_workflows_and_statuses: Which operational workflows and state transitions should be supported for requests, tickets, orders, tasks, and similar records?
AdminAndOperations.system_configuration_and_parameters: Do you need dedicated admin sections or workflows for configuring system-wide settings, parameters, and operational rules?

AuthAndPermissions.account_isolation: Should each user’s data and activity history be strictly isolated from other non-privileged users?
AuthAndPermissions.admin_user_management: Should administrators be able to create, update, deactivate, delete accounts, and manage other users’ roles and permissions from an admin interface?
AuthAndPermissions.login_and_authentication: Do you need a login and authentication flow, and which authentication methods should be supported (e.g. password, social login, third-party SSO)?
AuthAndPermissions.permission_assignment: Should permissions be managed only through roles or also via direct per-user assignment and revocation?
AuthAndPermissions.role_based_access_control: Do you need role-based access control to define and separate different permission levels for user groups?
AuthAndPermissions.user_registration: Do you need a user registration flow for creating new accounts, and what basic information must be collected?

CommerceAndTransactions.cart_and_checkout_flow: What cart and checkout steps should the purchase flow include (e.g., cart editing, address and options selection, review, confirmation)?
CommerceAndTransactions.catalog_browsing_and_selection: How should users browse and select offerings (e.g., catalog structure, item detail pages, filtering, sorting, real‑time availability)?
CommerceAndTransactions.fulfillment_shipping_and_after_sales: How should fulfillment and after‑sales processes work (e.g., shipping and delivery tracking, service add‑ons, returns and refunds)?
CommerceAndTransactions.order_and_transaction_lifecycle: What lifecycle stages and history views are needed for orders and transactions (e.g., status tracking, full history, filtering, subscription management)?
CommerceAndTransactions.payments_and_funds_handling: Which payment and funds operations should be supported (e.g., one‑time payments, stored balance, virtual currency, transfers, authorization/capture, invoicing)?
CommerceAndTransactions.pricing_discounts_and_fees: How should prices, discounts, coupons, and fees be calculated and applied during ordering and payment?
CommerceAndTransactions.specialized_transaction_flows: Do you need guided flows for specific transaction types (e.g., subscriptions, installments, loans, investments, group or flash sales, redemptions)?

CommunicationAndForms.communication_channels_and_modes: Which communication modes should the system support (e.g. contact forms, message board, real-time chat, group/one-to-one messaging, offline communication records)?
CommunicationAndForms.form_flow_and_guidance: For key submissions, do you need simple single-page forms or multi-step/guided flows with inline validation and clear status messages?
CommunicationAndForms.messaging_features_and_content: What messaging capabilities are needed (e.g. rich content types, presence/status, delivery/read indicators, deletion and recovery rules, internal ticket/project threads)?
CommunicationAndForms.notifications_and_preferences: Which notification channels and controls are required (e.g. in-app center, badges, timelines, email/SMS/push, user-configurable preferences)?
CommunicationAndForms.outbound_communications_configuration: How should outbound system or admin communications be managed and sent (e.g. automated responses, campaign targeting/scheduling, email service integration)?
CommunicationAndForms.security_and_verification_in_forms: Do forms and communication flows require additional security or verification steps (e.g. CAPTCHA handling, real-name or biometric checks)?
CommunicationAndForms.structured_forms_and_fields: Which interactions require structured forms with defined fields and validation (e.g. applications, inquiries, reports, feedback, support)?

DevelopmentAndOperations.application_lifecycle_management: Should users manage the full application lifecycle from within the platform (e.g. creation, configuration, structure, build, deployment, runtime status)?
DevelopmentAndOperations.automation_and_operational_workflows: Which automated operational workflows should the system support (e.g. installation/upgrade, deployment with hot reload, report analysis, optimization cycles, versioning/rollback)?
DevelopmentAndOperations.database_and_data_management: What database and data management capabilities should be available (e.g. connection profiles, schema inspection, CRUD interfaces, supported data sources)?
DevelopmentAndOperations.debugging_and_testing_tools: What debugging and rapid testing capabilities should be provided (e.g. breakpoints, step execution, log/console views, test harness integration)?
DevelopmentAndOperations.in_platform_development_tools: What in-platform development tools do you need (e.g. code editors, visual designers, preprocessing, syntax validation, unified client/server structure)?

ImportExportAndUpload.content_migration_scope: To what extent should existing content be migrated into the new system versus referenced from the original source?
ImportExportAndUpload.export_capabilities_and_formats: What export and download capabilities are needed (e.g. single vs bulk downloads, packaging of files, supported export formats and structures)?
ImportExportAndUpload.import_behavior: How should import operations behave (e.g. bulk import options, merge vs replace existing data, duplicate handling, supported import formats)?
ImportExportAndUpload.upload_capabilities: What upload capabilities do you need (e.g. single vs multiple files, required uploads, drag-and-drop, supported content types)?
ImportExportAndUpload.upload_process_feedback: What feedback and controls should the upload process provide (e.g. progress indicators, per-item status, cancel, retry)?
ImportExportAndUpload.upload_restrictions_and_validation: What restrictions and validation rules should apply to uploads (e.g. allowed formats, maximum file size, number of items per upload, special handling for large files)?
ImportExportAndUpload.upload_workflow_and_management: How should users manage uploaded items within the system (e.g. organize, rename, view, preview, update, delete)?

NavigationAndPages.entry_points_and_access_paths: From which entry points, platforms, or URLs should users be able to access key pages or sections, and should navigation be consistent across platforms?
NavigationAndPages.list_detail_and_multi_step_flows: Do you need dedicated list and detail views and/or guided multi-step flows for key tasks (e.g. browse list → view detail → complete action)?
NavigationAndPages.navigation_patterns_and_controls: What specific navigation patterns and controls should be supported within pages (e.g. carousels, diagrams, maps, tabs, sticky menus, paging between views)?
NavigationAndPages.page_and_section_layout: Which functions or content types should be grouped on the same page versus separated into distinct pages or flows (e.g. browsing vs management, information vs commerce, single-page vs multi-page steps)?
NavigationAndPages.primary_navigation_structure: What main sections and hierarchy should the primary navigation include, and should different user roles or audiences have separate navigation areas?
NavigationAndPages.specialized_pages_and_dashboards: Which specialized pages or dashboards are required for domain-specific entities or workflows (e.g. history records, reports, cases, projects, campaigns, merchant or admin portals)?
NavigationAndPages.url_routing_and_redirects: How should URL routing, parameter passing, and redirects be handled for valid, legacy, and invalid URLs (e.g. canonical redirects, error pages, auto-correction)?

ReviewsAndEngagement.comments_and_replies: Do you need a commenting system where users can view, add, and reply to comments on content or cases?
ReviewsAndEngagement.discussion_threads: Do you need threaded discussion topics with reply chains and lightweight reactions (e.g. likes)?
ReviewsAndEngagement.personal_list_interactions: What actions should users be able to perform on their personal lists or watchlists (e.g. add/remove items, reorder, mark as completed)?
ReviewsAndEngagement.ratings_and_reviews: Do you need a ratings and textual reviews system for evaluating entities (e.g. services, suppliers, users) after interactions?
ReviewsAndEngagement.review_interactions: What interactions should be supported on ratings and reviews (e.g. rating scale input, edit/delete own reviews, mark as helpful)?
ReviewsAndEngagement.user_generated_posts: Should users be able to create standalone rich posts to share experiences or content, including text and media?

RewardsAndEngagement.discount_code_application_flow: Do you need a dedicated step where users can select, enter, and validate discount codes or coupons during checkout or payment?
RewardsAndEngagement.membership_and_benefit_rules: Should membership levels or similar statuses influence points, discounts, coupons, or other benefits during transactions?
RewardsAndEngagement.points_earning_logic: Should users automatically earn points based on defined actions or behaviors, potentially with different values for different actions?
RewardsAndEngagement.points_feedback_interaction: Do you need immediate interactive feedback (e.g. notifications or animations) when users earn points?
RewardsAndEngagement.points_management_and_redemption_flow: Do you need a flow where users can view their points balance and history and redeem points for rewards directly in the system?

SchedulingAndAutomation.automation_rules_and_workflows: Do you need rule-based or time-based automation for tasks and workflows, such as routing, escalations, or recurring processes?
SchedulingAndAutomation.booking_and_appointment_flow: How should users create, confirm, cancel, and modify bookings or appointments, including any approval steps and confirmation pages?
SchedulingAndAutomation.calendar_and_scheduling_integration: Do you need integration or embedded widgets with external or third-party calendar and scheduling systems for syncing and booking?
SchedulingAndAutomation.notification_channels_and_subscriptions: Which notification channels should be supported and how should users configure their subscription preferences and reminders?
SchedulingAndAutomation.notifications_triggers_and_scheduling: Which events or schedules should trigger automated notifications or broadcasts, and how configurable should these rules be?
SchedulingAndAutomation.scheduling_and_time_slots: What types of schedules and time slots should be supported, including availability definitions, capacities, and prevention of conflicts?
SchedulingAndAutomation.user_schedule_self_service: To what extent should users manage their own schedules, such as viewing, rescheduling, and cancelling their bookings in a personal view?

SearchAndQuery.advanced_query_capabilities: Do you need advanced query capabilities such as executing custom queries, restricting certain operations, or applying spatial query tools?
SearchAndQuery.results_presentation: How should search or query results be presented to users (e.g. layout, key fields shown, pagination, export or copy options)?
SearchAndQuery.search_filters: What filtering or faceted criteria should be available to narrow search or list results (e.g. status, category, tags, time range, location)?
SearchAndQuery.search_input_style: How should users enter queries (e.g. basic keyword fields, structured criteria, or free-form natural language in a single box)?
SearchAndQuery.search_interaction_behavior: How should the search interaction behave (e.g. input triggers, suggestions, cross-module search by default, reusing past inputs like URLs or parameters)?
SearchAndQuery.search_scope: Which entities and fields should be searchable across the system (e.g. specific modules, metadata fields, or all content types)?
SearchAndQuery.search_sorting: Which sorting options should be available for search or list results (e.g. by date, relevance, name, popularity)?

SharingAndReferrals.code_based_sharing: Do you need code- or link-based mechanisms for accessing or promoting specific items or campaigns (e.g. referral codes, campaign links, QR codes)?
SharingAndReferrals.content_sharing_capabilities: What types of items should users be able to share and in what ways (e.g. shareable links, internal sharing, social platforms, downloads)?
SharingAndReferrals.referral_program_rules: What rules should govern any referral or invite program (e.g. reward type, calculation method, and eligibility conditions)?
SharingAndReferrals.sharing_channels: Which external or internal channels should be available for sharing content (e.g. social media, messaging apps, email, organization spaces)?

AccountsAndProfiles.account_core_fields: Which core account and credential fields should be stored for each user (e.g. identifiers, contact details, authentication and security data)?
AccountsAndProfiles.profile_activity_and_history: What types of user-related activity, history, or progress records should be stored as part of the account or profile (e.g. usage history, learning progress, transaction records)?
AccountsAndProfiles.profile_associated_assets: Should accounts or profiles own and manage associated assets or resources (e.g. addresses, linked accounts, portfolios, user-generated items)?
AccountsAndProfiles.profile_information_fields: Which personal or organizational profile fields should be stored and optionally displayed (e.g. bio, roles, preferences, verification status, domain-specific attributes)?
AccountsAndProfiles.profile_management_capabilities: Which aspects of accounts and profiles should users and administrators be able to view, create, update, or deactivate?
AccountsAndProfiles.role_specific_profiles: Do different user or organization roles require distinct profile structures, fields, or capabilities?

AnalyticsAndVisualization.automated_analytics_generation: Should the system automatically generate analysis artifacts (e.g. queries, visualization parameters, chart types, API parameters) from user input?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.dashboards_and_reports: What consolidated dashboards and configurable reports do you need for different domains or data sets?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.history_and_log_views: What historical, audit, or alert-log views and summaries should be available (e.g. past runs, past alerts, log statistics)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.interactive_visualization_controls: What kinds of interactive controls should visualizations provide (e.g. filtering, drill-down, zoom, view modes, parameter adjustments)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.metrics_and_kpis_scope: Which key metrics, KPIs, and time dimensions should analytics, monitoring, and comparative views focus on?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.visualization_content_configuration: To what extent should users or the system configure what is shown in visualizations and grids (e.g. data series, fields, detail level, comparison views)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.visualization_types_and_formats: Which visualization formats (e.g. charts, tables, maps, diagrams, time series, 2D/3D scenes) should be supported for presenting results?

DomainDataElements.content_types_and_metadata: What types of content items should exist and which metadata fields should each content type have (e.g. title, body, tags, media, read status)?
DomainDataElements.core_entity_types: Which core business or domain entities should the system manage as separate records (e.g. customers, orders, assets, locations, cases, courses)?
DomainDataElements.data_granularity_and_scope: At what granularity and scope should data be stored and presented (e.g. aggregated vs record-level, per entity vs per location vs per time interval)?
DomainDataElements.entity_field_structure: What key fields and attributes should each entity type contain (e.g. identifiers, descriptive fields, classifications, status, timestamps)?
DomainDataElements.entity_relationship_model: Which relationships between entities should be explicitly modeled and stored (e.g. orders linked to customers, tasks linked to assets, content linked to categories)?
DomainDataElements.event_and_history_records: Which time-based or transactional events and histories should be stored as structured records (e.g. inspections, alerts, notifications, backups, issues, research activities)?

EncryptedDataRecords.encryption_algorithm_options: Which encryption algorithms should be available for securing data and records?
EncryptedDataRecords.encryption_key_management: How should encryption keys be generated, provided, and managed (e.g. user-supplied, system-generated, external key management)?
EncryptedDataRecords.encryption_process_modes: Should the system support both real-time encryption/decryption during operations and batch processing for stored or uploaded data?
EncryptedDataRecords.immutable_record_storage: Should key events and operations be stored as immutable records on a tamper-resistant ledger that users can inspect?
EncryptedDataRecords.password_and_credential_protection: How should user credentials be protected at rest (e.g. strong one-way hashing with salt, non-reversible storage)?
EncryptedDataRecords.sensitive_data_retention_scope: What categories of sensitive data, if any, should the system store versus relying on external identifiers or minimal metadata?
EncryptedDataRecords.transport_and_rest_encryption: Should all sensitive data be protected with encryption both in transit (e.g. HTTPS) and at rest?

FinanceAndTransactions.account_balances_and_positions: How many balances or portfolios should each user have (e.g. single vs multiple accounts, different asset types, conversion rules)?
FinanceAndTransactions.financial_activity_overview: What real-time balance summaries and recent activity overviews (e.g. by account or asset) should be available to users?
FinanceAndTransactions.invoices_and_billing_documents: Do you need invoices or similar billing documents, and what structured information should each include?
FinanceAndTransactions.pricing_discounts_and_fees: Which pricing, discount, and fee models (e.g. coupons, special prices, commissions, taxes, surcharges) need to be supported and displayed?
FinanceAndTransactions.settlement_and_reconciliation_views: Do you need settlement and reconciliation views summarizing financial flows for stakeholders (e.g. merchants, suppliers, creators) with exportable records?
FinanceAndTransactions.transaction_record_fields: Which fields must each transaction record include (e.g. amount, fees, method, related parties, timestamps, status, references)?
FinanceAndTransactions.transaction_records_and_history: Which financial transactions should be recorded and viewable in history (e.g. payments, recharges, withdrawals, points, deposits) and at what level of detail?

MediaAndAssets.asset_infrastructure_and_optimization: What infrastructure and optimization strategies should be used for storing and delivering assets (e.g. cloud storage choice, CDN, compression, lazy loading)?
MediaAndAssets.media_display_and_download: How should media and files be presented and accessed in the interface (e.g. galleries, playback controls, knowledge base views, direct downloads, preview vs restricted access)?
MediaAndAssets.media_formats_and_sources: Which media/file formats and external or internal sources should be supported for assets and content (e.g. specific file types, APIs, local libraries)?
MediaAndAssets.media_management_capabilities: What management capabilities are needed for media and files (e.g. upload, delete, edit, reorganize, versioning, access control)?
MediaAndAssets.media_metadata_and_tagging: What metadata and annotation model should media and files support (e.g. fields to store, segment-level annotations, tagging approach, differentiated metadata by content type)?
MediaAndAssets.media_organization_structure: How should media and files be organized within the system (e.g. folders, categories, hierarchical vs flat structures, associations with other records or scenes)?
MediaAndAssets.media_storage_and_persistence: Which media and file types should be stored persistently in the system versus generated or provided only for one-time use or external reference (e.g. avatars, generated outputs, associated records)?

RankingAndLeaderboards.leaderboard_ranking_metrics: Which metrics should be used to calculate and rank entries on leaderboards (e.g. counts, ratings, engagement)?
RankingAndLeaderboards.leaderboard_scopes_and_views: Which leaderboard scopes or views should be available (e.g. global, subset-specific, friend-only) and how many top entries should be shown?
RankingAndLeaderboards.ranked_content_lists: Should the system display additional ranked content lists such as top-rated, most-reviewed, or trending items?

RulesAndLogic.access_and_permission_rules: Should access, permissions, and role capabilities be governed by configurable rules per resource, operation, and user segment?
RulesAndLogic.approval_and_submission_rules: Do you need rule-based submission and approval flows that define when items enter review, required steps, and criteria for approval or rejection?
RulesAndLogic.configurable_business_logic_engines: Should there be configurable engines or editors for defining business logic such as formulas, scoring models, classification rules, or alert thresholds?
RulesAndLogic.matching_and_recommendation_logic: Should matching and recommendation behavior be driven by configurable rules and criteria (e.g. eligibility filters, risk bands, categories, or scoring models)?
RulesAndLogic.pricing_and_benefit_rules: Do you need configurable rules for pricing and financial or reward logic (e.g. fees, discounts, referral rewards, membership levels, points, or trading limits)?
RulesAndLogic.status_and_lifecycle_workflows: Do you need configurable status and lifecycle workflows with defined stages and allowed transitions for key entities (e.g. bids, products, tasks, content, transactions)?
RulesAndLogic.validation_and_exception_handling_rules: Do you need explicit rules for validation, abnormal or overdue case handling, and exception workflows across core processes?

SettingsAndTemplates.admin_and_system_configuration: Which system-wide parameters and categories of settings should administrators be able to configure through the interface?
SettingsAndTemplates.configuration_audit_trail: Do you need an audit trail to record and review changes made to configurations or settings, including who changed what and when?
SettingsAndTemplates.configuration_information_architecture: How should configuration options be organized and structured (e.g. grouped into logical sections, pages, or modules)?
SettingsAndTemplates.content_and_communication_templates: Which types of reusable content or communication templates should the system support and allow users or admins to manage?
SettingsAndTemplates.layout_and_visual_templates: Do you need reusable layout or style templates/presets for pages, dashboards, or visual presentations that can be applied and customized?
SettingsAndTemplates.roles_and_permissions_configuration: Which roles and permission sets should exist and how configurable should access rights be across different modules or features?
SettingsAndTemplates.user_preferences_and_settings: Which personal or account-level settings should end users be able to view and adjust (e.g. notifications, display options, credentials)?

LayoutAndComponents.background_and_surface_styling: How should background and surface styling be applied to the layout and components (e.g. page background vs. component surfaces vs. accents)?
LayoutAndComponents.component_set_and_arrangement: Which UI components should be standard in the interface, and how should key components be arranged relative to each other on a page?
LayoutAndComponents.component_theming_and_consistency: Should UI components share a unified visual system for color, shape, spacing, and hierarchy across the product?
LayoutAndComponents.layout_consistency_across_views: How consistent should layout structures be across pages, roles, and modules (e.g. shared headers, navigation, and content patterns)?
LayoutAndComponents.layout_for_specific_functions: Do specific flows or page types require dedicated layout structures (e.g. carts, confirmations, wizards, personal centers, specialized workflows)?
LayoutAndComponents.page_layout_patterns: Which overall page layout patterns do you need for different views (e.g. single column, multi-column with sidebars, list-and-detail, dashboard-style)?
LayoutAndComponents.responsive_layout_and_breakpoints: Which responsive behaviors and screen-size breakpoints should the layout support, and how should structures adapt across devices?

ThemeAndColors.color_contrast_and_accessibility: What contrast or accessibility requirements should guide the combination of background, text, and component colors?
ThemeAndColors.global_theme_color_tokens: Which global theme color tokens (e.g. brand primaries, neutrals, semantic colors) should be defined for reuse across all pages and components?
ThemeAndColors.highlight_and_accent_colors: Which colors should be used as highlights or accents for key elements and emphasis (e.g. links, selected items, key metrics)?
ThemeAndColors.interactive_state_and_status_colors: Which colors should represent interaction states and statuses (e.g. hover, active, disabled, success, warning, error, priority levels)?
